ratings.comment: Prof. Bitzan was my favorite instructor of the semester. His passion and knowledge was truly inspiring. This course had a heavy reading load, but it was necessary to understand the material. Highly recommend taking a class with him if you get the chance. Also, the TA for this course, Chad Gibbs, was amazing as well.

You're graded mostly on papers and class participation, so come to class because you'll need the participation points and having the lecture notes makes writing the papers a breeze. It's a lot of reading though so stay on top of it. The papers are graded by a TA and as long as you do exactly as the outline says you'll get an A on them.

It's a 500 level history seminar, so it's obvs 80+ pages of reading a week. That being said, there were lots of non-majors in my class and they did fine. He really expects you to come to class having critically analyzed the reading so do that. He's a really great guy and offered a lot of insight into the subject. I really feel like I learned alot
Fantastic seminar. Prof. Bitzan is a rising star and UW is lucky to have him

Very interesting small class on antisemitism, with a bright young professor. There is a huge amount of reading as is customary in these types of classes. This class will only get better as it's offered more often.

He was a very clear professor, and really concerned about how the students performed in the class. If you went to class and made an effort to show you understood the reading, the class should be easy. There is a lot of reading, and I wouldn't recommend doing everyone, as some are repetitive. Also gave clear instructions for all papers that we had.

Cares a lot about his students and how they do; makes personal connections with them. But his lectures were very dry and boring and the reading he assigns every week is the same. It was easy to do well in his class if you attended lectures and read a decent amount of the work

Great professor for a seminar-- learned a ton in his class from discussion. Does a good job steering discussion, and clearly cares about his students. Can come off a little pretentious, but definitely a nice guy. He assigned a ton of reading, and it was absolutely necessary (long books every week).
